info.game_comments: IBM Challenge mini-documentary: "What is a Grand Challenge?"

(1, 1).clue: In 2010 he hit the shelves with his legal thriller "The Confession"

(2, 1).clue: Patton Oswalt cooked up the voice of Remy the Rodent in this 2007 Pixar film

(3, 1).clue: J. Edgar Hoover became the first director of the new FBI on March 22, 1935, serving this president

(4, 1).clue: Life magazine photographer Alfred Eisenstaedt snapped a sailor kissing a nurse on the August 1945 day known as this

(5, 1).clue: "Ho, ho, ho!"  This jolly guy has appeared in ads for vegetables since 1928; the company was named for him in 1950

(6, 1).clue: I try, & I try, but I can't get no this word meaning an act of gratification

(1, 2).clue: In 1936 this Jazz Age author detailed his physical & spiritual collapse in "The Crack-Up"

(2, 2).clue: From 1960 to 2010 Don Hastings played Bob Hughes on this "global" CBS soap opera

(3, 2).clue: Born in this city in 1895, J. Edgar Hoover graduated from its National University law school in 1917

(4, 2).clue: Certain Robert Mapplethorpe photos caused Congress to enact restrictions on grants given by this body
(4, 2).correct response: the NEA (National Endowment for the Arts)

(5, 2).clue: Robert Chesebrough produced a clear petroleum jelly & started selling it under this brand name in 1870

(6, 2).clue: A decrease in economic activity; I couldn't bear it!  I can't!  I won't!  I shan't!

(1, 3).clue: Peru's version of "Super Mario", he won the 2010 Nobel Prize for Literature

(2, 3).clue: Esai Morales lawyered up as Edward James Olmos' dad, Joseph Adama, in this "Battlestar Galactica" prequel

(3, 3).clue: Hoover's many innovations included establishing a national bank for these biometric identifiers

(4, 3).clue: John Filo, an undergrad at this Ohio school, won a 1971 Pulitzer after getting an iconic photo of a slain classmate

(5, 3).clue: "Choosy moms choose" this brand of peanut butter

(6, 3).clue: 2-word "atomic" term for a series of events in which each event is the result of the one preceding & the cause of the next

(1, 4).clue: Muriel Spark's 1961 novel about an eccentric Edinburgh teacher detailed "The Prime of Miss" this

(2, 4).clue: J.K. Simmons, seriously evil in "Oz", brought it down to "not so nice" as publisher J. Jonah Jameson in this 2002 film

(3, 4).clue: In the 1960s Hoover expanded his COINTELPRO plan to harass & disrupt this Southern extremist white power group

(4, 4).clue: Steve McCurry took a photo of an Afghan girl for this venerated magazine in 1984, then reunited with her 17 years later

(5, 4).clue: This brand's Wienermobile dates back to 1936

(6, 4).clue: Rotting, or the anaerobic decomposition of organic matter by bacteria

(1, 5).clue: This man who penned "A la recherche du temps perdu" suffered from asthma

(2, 5).clue: This "Some Like It Hot" co-star who died in 2010 turned to Matisse-influenced art in later years

(3, 5).clue: Among those Hoover's FBI tracked down & killed was this young-looking brute, in November 1934

(4, 5).clue: He told the Warren Commission of a nightmare in which his film plays out until its violent end & he snaps awake

(5, 5).clue: This superpremium ice cream brand produces a line called Five--with only (you guessed it) 5 ingredients

(6, 5).clue: For federal contracts, this 2-word employment term was first used in an order issued by JFK in 1961

(1, 1).clue: The star Arcturus is known as the "bear guard" because it guards this constellation

(2, 1).clue: 1981:"Kiss On My List"; they had 2 other No. 1s that year

(3, 1).clue: One of the "Six Crises" Richard Nixon faced in his book of that title was this president's heart attack

(5, 1).clue: In the 1959 book "Cubism", he is quoted as saying, "I paint objects as I think them, not as I see them"

(6, 1).clue: Attach this to your date on your way to the prom

(1, 2).clue: First named in 1603, Columba is also known as "Noah's" this, the bird that returned to the ark with an olive leaf

(2, 2).clue: 1988:"Look Away"; a groove from this pop-rock group with an urban name

(3, 2).clue: As part of this crisis, JFK announced a naval blockade Oct. 22, 1962

(5, 2).clue: In 1888 he wrote to his brother Theo, "I cannot help it that my paintings do not sell"

(6, 2).clue: The name of this drinking vessel comes from the Latin for "cup"

(1, 3).clue: Musca, or "the fly", was originally called Apis for this insect

(2, 3).clue: 1984:"Footloose"; kick off your Sunday shoes with this bearded guy

(4, 3).clue: Of presidents who died in office

(5, 3).clue: The New York Times reported he said, "If the public dislikes one of my Post covers, I can't help disliking it myself"

(6, 3).clue: Some of these small engravings date as far back as the 3rd century B.C.

(1, 4).clue: Vega is the main star of this constellation with the Latin name of an instrument

(2, 4).clue: 1984:"Against All Odds (Take A Look At Me Now)"; do you have the genesis of an idea about him?

(3, 4).clue: Speculative attacks on the Baht triggered this continent's financial crisis of 1997-98

(4, 4).clue: Of the colors of the Olympic rings

(5, 4).clue: John Singer Sargent reportedly said, "Every time I paint" this type of work, "I lose a friend"

(6, 4).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew uses paper cups & sheets of paper to demonstrate.) There is little support on one horizontal surface; however, with the load distributed  among several vertical surfaces, you get much stronger support when the paper is ridged this way, from the Latin for "wrinkle"

(1, 5).clue: An exquisite double star is part of the urn, or pitcher, in this constellation

(2, 5).clue: 1988:"Wishing Well"; whatever happened to him?  He lives in Milan & goes by Sananda Maitreya

(3, 5).clue: Bad feelings left by 1908's Bosnian crisis, in which this dual monarchy annexed Bosnia, helped start WWI

(5, 5).clue: He said, "One night I dreamt I painted a large American flag, and the next morning I... bought the materials to begin it"

(6, 5).clue: This large flightless ratite is found on New Guinea & nearby islands

(0, 0).clue: Its Declaration of Independence was signed in 1847 by 11 men in that nation's Providence Baptist Church
